did.unittitle: Cambodian Genocide Program, Yale University, records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of an implementation plan, reports, research material, correspondence, database printouts, and manuals documenting the Cambodian Genocide Program at Yale databases.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 37 (YRG 37), Records of associations, institutes, centers, and organizations affiliated with Yale.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Yale University is retained by Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Cambodian Genocide Program, Yale University, Records (RU 902). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Cambodian Genocide Program (CGP) at the Yale Center for International and Area Studies was created in 1995. Its establishment was funded by a grant from the U.S. Department of State. The program's mandate was to investigate, catalog, and make publicly available primary source material on the Khmer Rouge. The three components of the program are the program itself; the Documentation Center of Cambodia, which gathers and preserves documentation in Cambodia; and the Cambodia Justice Project, created to train Cambodians in international law.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of an implementation plan, reports, research material, correspondence, database printouts, and manuals documenting the Cambodian Genocide Program at Yale databases.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.

did.unittitle: " This black box contains information about victims, their families, interviewees, and other random people who were not members of the Khmer Rouge and who did not commit crimes [According to the testimony of the interviewees]."

"This blue box contains information about Khmer Rouge leaders, whether they committed crimes or not. The information comes from the testimony of people Ben Kiernan interviewed in his Southwest Zone interviews."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of two different snapshot copies of the project's database taken in 2001. Since then, the project has been resumed and the database has been added to, thus making this accession obsolete.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Contact Public Services (phone: 203 432-1735, e-mail: mssa.reference@yale.edu) for information on accessing this digital object.
